Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The GamePanel class is the class that mainly handles the user portion for the game. This class makes the panel and the game screen, it draws the objects and it controls the scoring and whether or not the ball dies or lives.
    Author:
    Michelle Hu and Jasmine Liu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePanel

        public GamePanel(Main w,
                 boolean multi)
        Creates a GamePanel object with set dimensions with a black background. Spawns balls and instantiates variables. A ratio is set to 30 to move the bars/power-ups/hoops by that amount each time.
        Parameters:
        w - Main object
        multi - boolean for whether or not there are multiple players

    • Method Detail

      • addHoop

        public void addHoop(double x,
                    double y,
                    int opt)
        Adds 4 hoops, each of a different color.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        opt - how many hoop colors
        Precondition:
        opt is between 1 and 4

      • addObstacle

        public void addObstacle(double x,
                        double y)
        Adds obstacles. It has a 50/50 chance of being a moving obstacle.
        Parameters:
        x-coord -
        y-coord -

      • addPowerUp

        public void addPowerUp(int x,
                       int y)
        Generates power-ups at specific coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of power-up
        y - y coordinate of power-up

      • changeGenRate

        public double changeGenRate()
        Changes the rate at which new objects are generated.
        Returns:
        the new rate that the objects will be generated

      • changeRatio

        public double changeRatio()
        changes ratio (how fast the objects move up on screen) by a factor of 1.001.
        Returns:

      • filterHoops

        public Hoop filterHoops(Ball ball)
        It does through all the hoops and removes those that have left the screen. It finds and returns the hoop that the ball needs to pass through.
        Returns:
        returns the hoops that the ball has to pass through in order to do scoring.

      • generateStuff

        public void generateStuff()
        Generates hoops/obstacles/power-ups at the bottom of the screen.

      • getKeyHandler

        public java.awt.event.KeyListener getKeyHandler()

      • getStart

        public boolean getStart()
        Returns whether or not the game has started.
        Returns:
        boolean that depicts whether or not the game has starts

      • hoopChecker

        public void hoopChecker(Hoop h,
                        Ball ball)
        Checks if the hoop that is at the ball's level is passed. A life is deducted if it doesn't.
        Parameters:
        h - the hoop at the same y as the ball with the same color - a hoop that the ball must go through.
        ball - the ball that is checked with the hoop

      • moveEverything

        public void moveEverything(double ratio)
        Moves up all hoops/power-ups/obstacles up by a certain amount(ratio).
        Parameters:
        ratio - amount that the hoops/power-ups/obstacles move up by

        Draws all the components.

      • removeObstacles

        public void removeObstacles()
        Removes obstacles from the game that have moved off the screen.

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean multi)
        Resets the game.
        Parameters:
        multi - boolean for whether or not there are multiple players

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the program as long as there are still lives left.
        Specified by:

      • setBallColor

        public void setBallColor(int c)
        Changes the ball's color to one that is indicated.
        Parameters:
        c - integer of what color the ball will be
        Precondition:
        c is between 0 and 3 inclusive.

      • setStart

        public void setStart(boolean b)
        Sets the start of the game.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean that will determine if the game started or not

      • spawnBall

        public Ball spawnBall()
        Randomly spawns a ball that is one of 4 colors. At (250,50) and with dimensions 25x25
        Returns:
        Ball with the appropriate color

      • spawnBall

        public Ball spawnBall(int color)

      • startThread

        public void startThread()
        Starts thread and background audio.

      • usePowerUp

        public void usePowerUp(PowerUp p)
        Uses the powerup when they get one. Lives may increase and color may change (won't revert). Things may get slowed down or the ball may shrink temporarily.
        Parameters:
        p - powerUp that is to be used
